content:
Okay, letΓÇÖs take a look at your posture.

Overall, your posture is showing some asymmetry, particularly in your head and shoulders. You have a noticeable forward head position, and your right elbow is carrying more than your left. 

HereΓÇÖs a breakdown of the key findings:

*   **Head & Neck:** Your forward head posture is currently at 9.9% on the left and 17.7% on the right, which is a mild deviation to keep an eye on. This means your head is trending forward relative to your shoulders. Gently tucking your chin back can help restore a more neutral alignment.

*   **Shoulders & Trunk:** You have a thoracic kyphosis angle of 35.1┬░ on the right, which is a larger deviation. Your pelvic obliquity is 2.6┬░, which is within the normal range.

*   **Knees:** Both knees exhibit a slight varus (bowing inward) alignment, with 2.1┬░ on the left and 2.3┬░ on the right. This is also within the normal range.

*   **Elbows:** Your right elbow is carrying at 22.8 degrees, while your left elbow
